text: The athletics events of the final stage of the 6th Summer Spartakiad of the Peoples of the USSR were held in the Central Lenin (Luzhniki) Stadium in Moscow between 27 July and 30 July 1979. Competition was won by Moscow, followed by Ukrainian SSR, and Russian SFSR. Two new Soviet records were made: Vladimir Kischkun won pole vault with a 5.45, breaking previous record by 4 cm, and Natalya Lebedeva won 100 metres hurdles with a new Soviet record of 12,8, cutting previous record by 0,2 seconds. Decathlon and pentathlon competitions took place in Tallinn, from 7 to 9 June. ==Men's events== {| |- | 100 m |||10.2 |||10.3 |||10.4 |- | 200 m |||20.6 |||20.9 |||20.9 |- | 400 m |||46.8 |||46.9 |||46.9 |- | 800 m |||1:47.3 |||1:47.8 |||1:47.9 |- | 1500 m |||3:41.3 | | |- | 5000 m |||13:38.0 | | |- | 10,000 m |||28:21.6 | | |- | Marathon |||2:15:27.8 | | |- | 20 km walk |||1:27:12.0 | | |- | 50 km walk |||3:58:54.8 | | |- | 110 m hurdles |||13.6 | | |- | 400 m hurdles |||49.5 | | |- | 3000 m SC |||8:27.6 | | |- | 4 × 100 m relay |Valery Ratushniy Aleksey Golourniy Vladimir Atamas Valery Borzov || 39.5 | | |- | 4 × 400 m relay |Yevgeny Borisenko Valery Yurchenko Leonid Korolyov Semyon Kocher || 3:07.4 | | |- | High jump |||2.21 | | |- | Pole vault |||5.45 NR | | |- | Long jump |||8.02 |||7.75 | |- | Triple jump |||17.33 | | |- | Shot put |||20.02 | | |- | Discus throw |||61.18 | | |- | Hammer throw |||75.52 | | |- | Javelin throw |||83.28 | | |- | Decathlon |||8229 | | |} ==Women's events== {| |- | 100 m |||11.3 |||11.4 | |- | 200 m |||22.8 | | |- | 400 m |||51.8 |||51.9 |||52.5 |- | 800 m |||1:59.4 | | |- | 1500 m |||4:07.9 | | |- | 3000 m |||9:00.6 | | |- | 100 m hurdles |||12.8 NR | | |- | 4 × 100 m relay |Nadezhda Besfamilnaya Lyudmila Maslakova Tatyana Sinyova Vera Anisimova || 43.7 | | |- | 4 × 400 m relay |Anna Dundere Sarmīte Štūla Ingrīda Barkāne Inta Kļimoviča || 3:30.2 | | |- | High jump |||1.85 | | |- | Long jump |||6.67 | | |- | Shot put |||21.02 | | |- | Discus throw |||67.80 | | |- | Javelin throw |||59.54 | | |- | Pentathlon |||4695 (4679) | | |} ==References== *Лёгкая атлетика. title: Athletics at the 1975 Spartakiad of the Peoples of the USSR
